recipes.name: Tinker: Plane Displacer
recipes.description: Meticulously crafted tinkers of a high quality have a much greater chance of succeeding.

recipes.name: Tinker: Supercollide-O-Tron
recipes.description: Meticulously crafted tinkers of a high quality have a much greater chance of succeeding.

recipes.name: Tinker: Alarm-O-Turret
recipes.description: Meticulously crafted tinkers of a high quality have a much greater chance of succeeding.

recipes.description: Meticulously crafted tinkers of a high quality have a much greater chance of succeeding.

recipes.description: Meticulously crafted tinkers of a high quality have a much greater chance of succeeding.

recipes.name: Rummage Through Scrap
recipes.description: Rummage through 5 pieces of scrap in effort to find sellable junk.

recipes.name: Recraft Equipment
recipes.description: Allows you to change the Optional Reagents and quality of equipment crafted with Dragon Isles Engineering.

recipes.name: Refine Hides - |A:Professions-ChatIcon-Quality-Tier2:20:20|a
recipes.description: Refines 5 Quality  rare hides and scales gathered from the creatures of the Dragon Isles to 1 Quality .

recipes.name: Refine Hides - |A:Professions-ChatIcon-Quality-Tier3:20:20|a
recipes.description: Refines 5 Quality  rare hides and scales gathered from the creatures of the Dragon Isles to 1 Quality .

recipes.name: Refine Leather - |A:Professions-ChatIcon-Quality-Tier2:20:20|a
recipes.description: Refines 5 Quality  leather gathered from the creatures of the Dragon Isles to 1 Quality .

recipes.name: Refine Leather - |A:Professions-ChatIcon-Quality-Tier3:20:20|a
recipes.description: Refines 5 Quality  leather gathered from the creatures of the Dragon Isles to 1 Quality .

recipes.name: Refine Scales - |A:Professions-ChatIcon-Quality-Tier2:20:20|a
recipes.description: Refines 5 Quality  scales gathered from the creatures of the Dragon Isles to 1 Quality .

recipes.name: Refine Scales - |A:Professions-ChatIcon-Quality-Tier3:20:20|a
recipes.description: Refines 5 Quality  scales gathered from the creatures of the Dragon Isles to 1 Quality .

recipes.name: Leather Skinning
recipes.description: Leather creatures of all shapes and sizes roam the Dragon Isles, covering a plethora of locales and climates. Such beasts include bears, ottuks, and even mighty mammoths.

recipes.name: Scale Skinning
recipes.description: As one might expect, there is a wide variety of scaled creatures inhabiting the Dragon Isles. There have been early reports of Thunder Lizards, Basilisks, and Wind Serpents... but who knows what else may be present?

recipes.name: Curious Hide
recipes.description:
The hides of some creatures on the Dragon Isles have strange, unique properties. While these curious hides may not be suitable for crafting, taking a moment to study them will grant further knowledge towards your skinning specializations.

You may discover 6 more sample(s) this week.

recipes.name: Dense Hide
recipes.description:
Skinners who gather from leathery creatures have a small chance to find remarkable Dense Hides.

These hides are a rare material that are suitable to a large range of purposes due to their durability and malleability.

recipes.name: Lustrous Scaled Hide
recipes.description:
When skinning scaled creatures, a skinner may chance upon a magnificent Lustrous Scaled Hide.

These rare specimens are far stronger than their common counterparts and can be used for a variety of purposes ranging from practical to aesthetic.

recipes.name: Saturated Bone
recipes.description:
The elements awakening across the Dragon Isles can infuse even the local wildlife. Industrious skinners may find samples of bone that have been particularly affected by this rare phenomenon.

Studying such samples could prove beneficial in the form of new knowledge.

recipes.name: Obsidian Seared Alloy
recipes.description: Find the Earth Warder's Forge within Dragonbane Keep, located in the west of The Waking Shores.

recipes.name: Black Dragon Touched Hammer
recipes.description: Find the Earth Warder's Forge within Dragonbane Keep, located in the west of The Waking Shores.

recipes.name: Recraft Equipment
recipes.description: Allows you to change the Optional Reagents and quality of equipment crafted with Dragon Isles Blacksmithing.

recipes.name: Reclaimed Gauntlet Chassis
recipes.description: A suitable vessel for a new legacy.

recipes.name: Writ of Critical Strike
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a ring to increase your Critical Strike by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Writ of Haste
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a ring to increase your Haste by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Writ of Mastery
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a ring to increase your Mastery by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Writ of Versatility
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a ring to increase your Versatility by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Devotion of Critical Strike
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a ring to increase your Critical Strike by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Devotion of Haste
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a ring to increase your Haste by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Devotion of Versatility
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a ring to increase your Versatility by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Recraft Equipment
recipes.description: Allows you to change the Optional Reagents and quality of equipment crafted with Dragon Isles Enchanting.

recipes.name: Writ of Avoidance
recipes.description: Permanently enchants bracers to increase your Avoidance by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Writ of Leech
recipes.description: Permanently enchants bracers to increase your Leech by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Writ of Speed
recipes.description: Permanently enchants bracers to increase your Speed by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Devotion of Avoidance
recipes.description: Permanently enchants bracers to increase your Avoidance by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Devotion of Leech
recipes.description: Permanently enchants bracers to increase your Leech by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Devotion of Speed
recipes.description: Permanently enchants bracers to increase your Speed by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Writ of Avoidance
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a cloak to increase your Avoidance by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Writ of Leech
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a cloak to increase your Leech by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Writ of Speed
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a cloak to increase your Speed by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Graceful Avoidance
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a cloak to increase your Avoidance by $ec1 and reduce fall damage taken by $ec2s1%. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Regenerative Leech
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a cloak to increase your Leech by $ec1 and heal for $ec2s1 every 5 sec while out of combat. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Homebound Speed
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a cloak to increase your Speed by $ec1 and reduce the cooldown of your Hearthstone by $ec2s1/-60000${$ec2s1/-60000} minutes while in the Dragon Isles. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Waking Stats
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a chestpiece to increase your primary stats by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Accelerated Agility
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a chestpiece to increase your Agility by $ec1 and Speed by $ec2. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Reserve of Intellect
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a chestpiece to increase your Intellect by $ec1 and mana pool by $ec2s1%. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Sustained Strength
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a chestpiece to increase your Strength by $ec1 and Stamina by $ec2. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Plainsrunner's Breeze
recipes.description: Permanently enchants boots to increase your Speed by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Rider's Reassurance
recipes.description: Permanently enchants boots to increase your mounted speed by $ec1s1%. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Watcher's Loam
recipes.description: Permanently enchants boots to increase your Stamina by $ec1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Draconic Deftness
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a gathering tool to increase your Deftness by $ec1.

recipes.name: Draconic Finesse
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a gathering tool to increase your Finesse by $ec1.

recipes.name: Draconic Inspiration
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a crafting tool to increase your Inspiration by $ec1.

recipes.name: Draconic Perception
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a gathering or fishing tool to increase your Perception by $ec1.

recipes.name: Draconic Resourcefulness
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a crafting or cooking tool to increase your Resourcefulness by $ec1.

recipes.name: Burning Writ
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to sometimes incite flames, increasing your Critical Strike by $ec1s1 for 15 sec. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Earthen Writ
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to sometimes rumble the earth, increasing your Mastery by $ec1s1 for 15 sec. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Sophic Writ
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to sometimes beckon Order, increasing your primary stat by $ec1s1 for 15 sec. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Frozen Writ
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to sometimes chill your veins, increasing your Versatility by $ec1s1 for 15 sec. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Wafting Writ
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to sometimes draw a breeze, increasing your Haste by $ec1s1 for 15 sec. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Burning Devotion
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to sometimes ignite, causing your next heal to additionally cauterize an ally's wounds, healing for $ec1s1. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Earthen Devotion
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to sometimes ground yourself, increasing your Armor by $ec1s1 for 15 sec. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Sophic Devotion
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to sometimes harness Order, increasing your primary stat by $ec1s1 for 15 sec. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Frozen Devotion
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to sometimes radiate ice, dealing $ec1s1 Frost damage split between enemies in front of you. Damage is increased for each enemy struck, up to 5 enemies. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Wafting Devotion
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to sometimes sway the winds, increasing your Haste by $ec1s1 and Speed by $ec1s2 for 15 sec. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Shadowflame Wreathe
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to erupt with Shadowflame, causing your damaging spells and abilities to sometimes inflict $ec1s1*$406764d${$ec1s1*$406764d} Shadowflame damage to your target over 12 sec while instantly inflicting $ec1s1 Shadowflame damage to yourself. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Spore Tender
recipes.description: Permanently enchants a weapon to cultivate living spores, causing your healing spells and abilities to occasionally send an Invigorating Spore Cloud to your target. It will grant them $ec1s1 of their highest secondary stat for 12 sec. Cannot be applied to items lower than level $ecim.

recipes.name: Illusory Adornment: Fire
recipes.description: Temporarily imbues shoulders with a fiery illusion for $ecd.

recipes.name: Illusory Adornment: Frost
recipes.description: Temporarily imbues shoulders with a frosted illusion for $ecd.

recipes.name: Illusory Adornment: Air
recipes.description: Temporarily imbues shoulders with a windswept illusion for $ecd.

recipes.name: Illusory Adornment: Earth
recipes.description: Temporarily imbues shoulders with an earthen illusion for $ecd.

recipes.name: Illusory Adornment: Order
recipes.description: Temporarily imbues shoulders with an illusion of Order for $ecd.

recipes.name: Illusory Adornment: Spores
recipes.description: Temporarily imbues shoulders with an illusion of spores for $ecd.

recipes.name: Crystalline Shatter
recipes.description: Shatter an Enchanting reagent into 3 of lesser rarity.

recipes.name: Elemental Shatter
recipes.description:
Shatter an Awakened element to gain its power for 10 min.

Can only be performed in the Dragon Isles.

recipes.name: Refine Herbs - |A:Professions-ChatIcon-Quality-Tier2:20:20|a
recipes.description: Refines 5 Quality  herbs gathered from the Dragon Isles to 1 Quality .

recipes.name: Refine Herbs - |A:Professions-ChatIcon-Quality-Tier3:20:20|a
recipes.description: Refines 5 Quality  herbs gathered from the Dragon Isles to 1 Quality .

recipes.name: Hochenblume
recipes.description: Hochenblume is the most common herb found across the Dragon Isles. It can be found in practically any terrain, growing wherever possible.

recipes.name: Infurious Hochenblume
recipes.description:
Hochenblume is the most common herb found across the Dragon Isles. It can be found in practically any terrain, growing wherever possible.
 
Found growing only in places of embroiled conflict, rumor has it that these herbs have gained magical properties from the ire of those fighting around them. 

Gain the following effect when gathering: 

 Fury of Battle:
You have a chance when slaying enemy players to gain Rousing Ire. Lasts 2 min.

Further mining or herb gathering extends the duration.

recipes.name: Decayed Hochenblume
recipes.description:
Hochenblume is the most common herb found across the Dragon Isles. It can be found in practically any terrain, growing wherever possible.

Herbs exposed to the essence of Decay become wilted versions of their former selves. The plants are still usable, but any would-be gatherers are exposed to the Decay, afflicting them with illness. It can be worth it though, as these herbs are a dependable source of Rousing Decay.

Herbalists specialized in Decayed herbs will gain the following effect when gathering:

 Controlled Decay:
Become empowered by present Decay magic. Your Overload Elemental Herb spell is recharging at 400% the normal rate.

recipes.name: Frigid Hochenblume
recipes.description:
Hochenblume is the most common herb found across the Dragon Isles. It can be found in practically any terrain, growing wherever possible.

When exposed to colder climates or are located near sources of water, they can become infused with elemental frost. Gathering these types of herbs will cover the ground in slick ice, but the herbalist will be rewarded with Rousing Frost for their efforts.

Herbalists specialized in Frigid herbs will gain the following effect when gathering:

 Frigid Petals:
Envelops you in a cloud of frost which causes any enemy who approaches too close to you to become frozen momentarily.

recipes.name: Lush Hochenblume
recipes.description:
Hochenblume is the most common herb found across the Dragon Isles. It can be found in practically any terrain, growing wherever possible.

Some herbs grow particularly well and thrive for any number of reasons, regardless of climate or location. Herbalists who come across these rare nodes can retrieve additional usable materials.

recipes.name: Titan-Touched Hochenblume
recipes.description:
Hochenblume is the most common herb found across the Dragon Isles. It can be found in practically any terrain, growing wherever possible.

Herbs that grow in areas rich in the influence of the Titans, such as the Waking Shores or Thaldraszus, may similarly become empowered. These types of herbs grant a boon to the herbalist who stumbles upon them, as well as some Rousing Order.

Herbalists specialized in Titan-Touched herbs will gain the following effect when gathering:

 Enlightened Potential:
Speed increased by 15%. Gatherers specialized in Titan-Touched nodes will also have their secondary stats increased by 3%.

recipes.name: Windswept Hochenblume
recipes.description:
Hochenblume is the most common herb found across the Dragon Isles. It can be found in practically any terrain, growing wherever possible.

Herbs that grow up high or in particularly windy regions like the Ohn'ahran Plains can absorb the elemental power of air. Powerful gusts of wind is unleashed when these herbs are gathered, knocking the herbalist away. However, it is an effective way to find Rousing Air.

Herbalists specialized in Windswept herbs will gain the following effect when gathering:

 Windswept:
When falling farther than 40 yd, a powerful gust of wind slows your descent.

recipes.name: Lambent Hochenblume
recipes.description:
Hochenblume is the most common herb found across the Dragon Isles. It can be found in practically any terrain, growing wherever possible.

Lambent herbs can only be found in Zaralek Cavern.

Gain the following effect when gathering:

 Zaralek Glowbur:
Covers you in radiant spores that are eager to propagate. Lasts 2 min.

recipes.name: Saxifrage
recipes.description: Saxifrage is a sturdy herb that can grow in a multitude of places. While generally found in rugged locations like mountains or on cliffs, it can also be found upon the open plains or scarcely within volcanic regions.

recipes.name: Infurious Saxifrage
recipes.description:
Saxifrage is a sturdy herb that can grow in a multitude of places. While generally found in rugged locations like mountains or on cliffs, it can also be found upon the open plains or scarcely within volcanic regions.  

Found growing only in places of embroiled conflict, rumor has it that these herbs have gained magical properties from the ire of those fighting around them. 

Gain the following effect when gathering: 

 Fury of Battle:
You have a chance when slaying enemy players to gain Rousing Ire. Lasts 2 min.

Further mining or herb gathering extends the duration.

recipes.name: Writhebark
recipes.description: Writhebark is a verdant herb found on the Dragon Isles. It can be found where there is an abundance of trees or foliage.

recipes.name: Infurious Writhebark

Covers you in radiant spores that are eager to propagate. Lasts 2 min.

recipes.name: Bubble Poppy
recipes.description:
Bubble Poppy is a delicate herb that grows in the aquatic locales of the Dragon Isles. It grows along the rivers, coasts, and inside damp caves. 

Despite its unique appearance, the Bubble Poppy flower isn't particularly useful. Rather, the watery, fungal orb that forms at its base is where the real value lies.

recipes.name: Lush Bubble Poppy
recipes.description:
Bubble Poppy is a delicate herb that grows in the aquatic locales of the Dragon Isles. It grows along the rivers, coasts, and inside damp caves. 

Despite its unique appearance, the Bubble Poppy flower isn't particularly useful. Rather, the watery, fungal orb that forms at its base is where the real value lies.

Some herbs grow particularly well and thrive for any number of reasons, regardless of climate or location. Herbalists who come across these rare nodes can retrieve additional usable materials.

recipes.name: Titan-Touched Bubble Poppy
recipes.description:
Bubble Poppy is a delicate herb that grows in the aquatic locales of the Dragon Isles. It grows along the rivers, coasts, and inside damp caves. 

Despite its unique appearance, the Bubble Poppy flower isn't particularly useful. Rather, the watery, fungal orb that forms at its base is where the real value lies.

Herbs that grow in areas rich in the influence of the Titans, such as the Waking Shores or Thaldraszus, may similarly become empowered. These types of herbs grant a boon to the herbalist who stumbles upon them, as well as some Rousing Order.

Herbalists specialized in Titan-Touched herbs will gain the following effect when gathering:

 Enlightened Potential:
Speed increased by 15%. Gatherers specialized in Titan-Touched nodes will also have their secondary stats increased by 3%.

recipes.name: Windswept Bubble Poppy
recipes.description:
Bubble Poppy is a delicate herb that grows in the aquatic locales of the Dragon Isles. It grows along the rivers, coasts, and inside damp caves. 

Despite its unique appearance, the Bubble Poppy flower isn't particularly useful. Rather, the watery, fungal orb that forms at its base is where the real value lies.

Herbs that grow up high or in particularly windy regions like the Ohn'ahran Plains can absorb the elemental power of air. Powerful gusts of wind is unleashed when these herbs are gathered, knocking the herbalist away. However, it is an effective way to find Rousing Air.

Herbalists specialized in Windswept herbs will gain the following effect when gathering:

 Windswept:
When falling farther than 40 yd, a powerful gust of wind slows your descent.

recipes.name: Lambent Bubble Poppy
recipes.description:
Bubble Poppy is a delicate herb that grows in the aquatic locales of the Dragon Isles. It grows along the rivers, coasts, and inside damp caves. 

Despite its unique appearance, the Bubble Poppy flower isn't particularly useful. Rather, the watery, fungal orb that forms at its base is where the real value lies.

Lambent herbs can only be found in Zaralek Cavern.

Gain the following effect when gathering:

 Zaralek Glowbur:
Covers you in radiant spores that are eager to propagate. Lasts 2 min.

recipes.name: Overload Infurious Herb
recipes.description: Overloading this type of herb will cause a devastating shockwave to knockback nearby enemies and fortify yourself.

recipes.name: Overload Decayed Herb
recipes.description: Overloading a decayed herb will summon forth a Withering Writhebark, a creature that has been afflicted with decay. Defeating this creature will award herbs and Rousing Decay.

recipes.name: Overload Frigid Herb
recipes.description: Overloading this type of herb will reveal a block of ice with herbs encased inside of it. Attacking this block of ice will break off chunks, which can be walked over to collect herbs and Rousing Frost.

recipes.name: Overload Titan-Touched Herb
recipes.description: Overloading this type of herb will cause a portal to open to another nearby herb. Specialized herbalists will open a portal back after gathering at their destination.

recipes.name: Overload Windswept Herb
recipes.description: Overloading this type of herb cause a massive gust of air to rapidly launch you upwards, allowing you to slowly fall back to the ground while collecting herbs and Rousing Air.

recipes.name: Overload Lambent Herb
recipes.description: Overloading a Lambent herb reveals a skulking spore creature hiding within. It will attempt to flee, leaving Zaralek Glowspores in its wake.

recipes.name: Dreambloom
recipes.description:
A rare flower that blooms petal by petal can be found growing alongside the other herbs of the Dragon Isles. While it doesn't have many properties that would make it directly useful for other professions, taking a moment to study it will help you learn more about the local flora, granting further knowledge towards your herbalism specializations.

You may discover 6 more sample(s) this week.

recipes.name: Infused Pollen
recipes.description:
As the elemental energies of the Dragon Isles awaken, they tether themselves to materials of all sorts. Diligent herbalists may find samples of pollen that have been bound with these energies.

While it could be dangerous to disturb it, you can gain knowledge by studying such a rare phenomenon.

recipes.name: Refine Serevite |A:Professions-ChatIcon-Quality-Tier2:20:20|a
recipes.description: Refines 5 Serevite Ore  to 1 Serevite Ore .

recipes.name: Refine Serevite |A:Professions-ChatIcon-Quality-Tier3:20:20|a
recipes.description: Refines 5 Serevite Ore  to 1 Serevite Ore .

recipes.description: Refines 5 Draconium Ore  to 1 Draconium Ore .

recipes.description: Refines 5 Draconium Ore  to 1 Draconium Ore .

recipes.description: Refines 5 Khaz'gorite Ore  to 1 Khaz'gorite Ore .

recipes.name: Draconium Deposit
recipes.description: Draconium Deposits are a rare find upon the Dragon Isles, but they are more often spotted in rugged or hard to reach locations.

recipes.name: Molten Draconium Deposit
recipes.description:
Draconium Deposits are a rare find upon the Dragon Isles, but they are more often spotted in rugged or hard to reach locations.

They are sometimes enveloped in flames, particularly in geologically active regions. Its unbearable heat often deters novice miners from harvesting its abundance of Rousing Fire.

Miners specialized in Molten nodes will gain the following effect when mining:

 Molten Fury:
Envelops you in flame which causes your attackers to suffer 1,716 Fire damage. Lasts 2 min.

recipes.name: Rich Draconium Deposit
recipes.description:
Draconium Deposits are a rare find upon the Dragon Isles, but they are more often spotted in rugged or hard to reach locations.

Rich deposits are particularly dense with ore, sure to delight any miner to stumble upon one.

recipes.name: Draconium Seam
recipes.description: Draconium Deposits are a rare find upon the Dragon Isles, but they are more often spotted in rugged or hard to reach locations. Seams are remarkably rare deposits found only deep underground, but are immensely rewarding for any spelunker who finds one.

recipes.name: Titan-Touched Draconium Deposit
recipes.description:
Draconium Deposits are a rare find upon the Dragon Isles, but they are more often spotted in rugged or hard to reach locations.

They are sometimes empowered by small Titan research constructs. Fortunately, they would sooner grant a miner their boon rather than retaliate.

Gain the following effect when mining:

 Enlightened Potential:
Speed increased by 15%. Gatherers specialized in Titan-Touched nodes will also have their secondary stats increased by 3%.

recipes.name: Primal Draconium Deposit
recipes.description:
Draconium Deposits are a rare find upon the Dragon Isles, but they are more often spotted in rugged or hard to reach locations.

They are sometimes marked by the primal elements and may reveal additional Rousing Elements beyond what is normally discovered when mining.

Miners specialized in Primal nodes gain the following effect when mining:

 Explosive Elements:
Cooldown reduction on Overload increased by 30%. Specialized miners have a chance to deal bonus Elemental damage with their spells and abilities. Lasts 2 min.

recipes.name: Hardened Draconium Deposit
recipes.description:
Draconium Deposits are a rare find upon the Dragon Isles, but they are more often spotted in rugged or hard to reach locations.

They are sometimes protected by a thick layer of extra rock which significantly slows the rate at which miners can claim its valuable ore.

Miners specialized in Hardened nodes gain the following effect when mining:

 Hardened Skin:
Damage taken reduced by 5%. Lasts 2 min.

recipes.name: Infurious Draconium Deposit
recipes.description:
Draconium Deposits are a rare find upon the Dragon Isles, but they are more often spotted in rugged or hard to reach locations.

Found only in areas of intense conflict, it is said that the ire of those fighting around this deposit provides magical effects to the survivors who inevitably claim it.  

Gain the following effect when mining: 

 Fury of Battle:
You have a chance when slaying enemy players to gain Rousing Ire. Lasts 2 min.

Further mining or herb gathering extends the duration.

recipes.name: Metamorphic Draconium Deposit
recipes.description:
Draconium Deposits are a rare find upon the Dragon Isles, but they are more often spotted in rugged or hard to reach locations.

Ore deposits in an active metamorphic state can only be found in Zaralek Cavern.

Gain the following effect when mining:

 Zaralek Glowdust:
Covers you in glowing dust that is perfect to assist in the propagation of spores. Lasts 2 min.

recipes.name: Serevite Deposit
recipes.description: Serevite is the most common ore found across the Dragon Isles. Though it is often found in mountainous regions, it is also revealed around flowing bodies of water.

recipes.name: Molten Serevite Deposit
recipes.description:
Serevite is the most common ore found across the Dragon Isles. Though it is often found in mountainous regions, it is also revealed around flowing bodies of water.

They are sometimes enveloped in flames, particularly in geologically active regions. Its unbearable heat often deters novice miners from harvesting its abundance of Rousing Fire.

Miners specialized in Molten nodes will gain the following effect when mining: 

 Molten Fury:
Envelops you in flame which causes your attackers to suffer 1,716 Fire damage. Lasts 2 min.

recipes.name: Rich Serevite Deposit
recipes.description:

Rich deposits are particularly dense with ore, sure to delight any miner to stumble upon one.

Miners specialized in Hardened nodes gain the following effect when mining:

Damage taken reduced by 5%. Lasts 2 min.

You have a chance when slaying enemy players to gain Rousing Ire. Lasts 2 min.

recipes.name: Serevite Seam
recipes.description: Serevite is the most common ore found across the Dragon Isles. Though it is often found in mountainous regions, it is also revealed around flowing bodies of water. Seams are remarkably rare deposits found only deep underground, but are immensely rewarding for any spelunker who finds one.

recipes.name: Metamorphic Serevite Deposit
recipes.description:
Serevite is the most common ore found across the Dragon Isles. Though it is often found in mountainous regions, it is also revealed around flowing bodies of water.

Ore deposits in an active metamorphic state can only be found in Zaralek Cavern.

Gain the following effect when mining:

 Zaralek Glowdust:
Covers you in glowing dust that is perfect to assist in the propagation of spores. Lasts 2 min.

recipes.name: Overload Molten Deposit
recipes.description: Overloading this type of deposit will anger a raging fire elemental lurking within. Slaying it will yield bonus Rousing Fire.

recipes.name: Overload Hardened Deposit
recipes.description: Overloading this type of deposit will cause some of its outer shell to erupt into mineable chunks that give bonus Rousing Earth.

recipes.name: Overload Primal Deposit
recipes.description: Overloading this type of deposit will grant you all boons gained when mining themed nodes, regardless of your specializations, for 3 min.

recipes.name: Overload Titan Deposit
recipes.description: Overloading this type of deposit will cause a portal to open to a nearby mining node. Specialized miners will open a portal back after mining at their destination.

recipes.name: Overload Infurious Deposit
recipes.description: Overloading this type of deposit will cause a devastating shockwave to knockback nearby enemies and fortify yourself.

recipes.name: Overload Metamorphic Deposit
recipes.description: Overloading a Metamorphic deposit causes Zaralek Cavern to quake. Watch your step, but be ready to collect the Zaralek Glowspores that are revealed.

recipes.name: Iridescent Ore
recipes.description:
Chunks of Iridescent Ore are often found by diligent miners as they scour the Dragon Isles. Taking a moment to study these will grant further knowledge toward your mining specializations.

You may discover 6 more sample(s) this week.

recipes.name: Elementally-Charged Stone
recipes.description:
Attentive and curious miners may sometimes discover geological samples that had been infused with multiple elements. Even these remnant energies are determined to not relinquish their grasp on the materials they have latched onto.

While it would be unwise to disturb it, there may be something to learn by studying the magical binding.

recipes.name: Khaz'gorite
recipes.description: The days of Khaz'gorite emerging on the surface of the Dragon Isles have long since passed. Miners seeking this rare ore can only depend on trace amounts being uncovered when mining other metals.

recipes.name: Azureweave Bolt
recipes.description: This mystical cloth can only be woven at a special loom in the Azure Archives, located in the southern area of The Azure Span.

recipes.name: Chronocloth Bolt
recipes.description: This cloth can only be woven at a special loom found at the Temporal Conflux, located in the south of Thaldraszus.

recipes.name: Dragon Isles Unravelling
recipes.description: Unravel 5 cloth from the Dragon Isles and spin it into thread. This will destroy the cloth.

recipes.name: Recraft Equipment
recipes.description: Allows you to change the Optional Reagents and quality of equipment crafted with Dragon Isles Tailoring.

recipes.name: Fiddle with Draconium Fabric Cutters
recipes.description: Having mastered your craft, perhaps fiddling with your tools will stimulate your mind? The only guarantee is their destruction!

recipes.name: Fiddle with Khaz'gorite Fabric Cutters
recipes.description: Having mastered your craft, perhaps fiddling with your tools will stimulate your mind? The only guarantee is their destruction!

recipes.name: Vantus Rune: Vault of the Incarnates
Vantus Rune: Aberrus, the Shadowed Crucible
Dragon Isles Milling
recipes.description: Crush 5 Dragon Isles herbs to create pigments for making inks.  This will destroy the herbs in the process.

recipes.description: Allows you to change the Optional Reagents and quality of equipment crafted with Dragon Isles Inscription.

recipes.name: Extraction: Awakened Fire
recipes.description:
Extract the burning components from Darkmoon Cards of Fire.  

This will destroy the Darkmoon Card in the process.

recipes.name: Extraction: Awakened Frost
recipes.description:
Extract the freezing components from Darkmoon Cards of Frost. 

This will destroy the Darkmoon Card in the process.

recipes.name: Extraction: Awakened Air
recipes.description:
Extract the flowing components from Darkmoon Cards of Air. 

This will destroy the Darkmoon Card in the process.

recipes.name: Extraction: Awakened Earth
recipes.description:
Extract the earthen components from Darkmoon Cards of Earth. 

This will destroy the Darkmoon Card in the process.

recipes.name: Thousandbite Piranha Swarm
recipes.description:
Thousandbite Piranha are an aggressive freshwater fish that will devour anything in sight! 

These freshwater swarms are found primarily in vast lakes and sprawling river systems across the Dragon Isles.

They are especially active in areas such as The Ohn'ahran Plains and The Waking Shores.

recipes.name: Temporal Dragonhead School
recipes.description:
Temporal Dragonhead are a peculiar fish whose scales seem to displace forwards and backwards every few seconds. Keep your fingers away from their sharp snout!

These freshwater schools can be found primarily in the vast lakes and sprawling river systems around the Dragon Isles.

They are especially active in areas such as the Uktulut Backwater in The Waking Shores.

recipes.name: Cerulean Spinefish School
recipes.description:
Cerulean Spinefish are a sturdy fish adorned with many sharp spines.

These saltwater schools can be found primarily in the ocean and other bodies of water connected to it.

They are especially active in areas such as the river openings around The Waking Shores.

recipes.name: Aileron Seamoth School
recipes.description:
Aileron Seamoth glide across the ocean floor and jet upwards when they suspect a tasty treat!

These saltwater schools can be found primarily in the ocean and other bodies of water connected to it.

They are especially active in areas such as Iskaara in The Azure Span.

recipes.name: Shimmering Treasure Pool
recipes.description:
Shimmering Treasure can appear in all bodies of water across the Dragon Isles. These pools contain untold treasures and are what every angler hopes to stumble upon.
 
Fishing in these pools significantly increases your chance for rare treasures.

recipes.name: Islefin Dorado Pool
recipes.description:
Islefin Dorado are an elusive fish whose fin is said to resemble the Dragon isles.
 
They are found in all bodies of water around the isles.

recipes.name: Scalebelly Mackerel
recipes.description:
Scalebelly Mackerel are an incredibly common fish in the Dragon Isles. They are easily caught in all bodies of water. 

Tossing unused Scalebelly Mackerel back into the water is a routine exercise done by even the most experienced Anglers.

recipes.name: Rimefin Tuna Pool
recipes.description:
Rimefin Tuna are a large, fatty fish coated in a thin layer of protective ice. The thick layer of fat protects their vital organs in below freezing temperatures. 

You can find these pools in especially frosty climates around the Dragon Isles.

The Iskaara Tuskarr are experts in catching these kinds of special fish.

recipes.name: Magma Thresher Pool
recipes.description:
Magma Threshers are a muscular fish with a hardened outer shell consisting of various minerals.

You can find these pools in especially hot climates around the Dragon Isles.

The Iskaara Tuskarr are experts in catching these kinds of special fish.

recipes.name: Prismatic Leaper School
recipes.description:
Prismatic Leapers are a curious, agile fish with scales that shimmer when caught in the light.

These fish love to leap from the water and can be found at some of the highest points around the Dragon Isles.

The Iskaara Tuskarr are experts in catching these kinds of special fish.

recipes.name: Witherrot Tome
recipes.description: This putrid recipe requires an altar infused with powerful decay magic, rumored to be deep in Brackenhide Hollow.

recipes.description: Destroy a random element from the core of an Awakened Order, revealing the three remaining elements in the process.
